name: Priest with a Secret Life - Cleric 26 / Rogue 13 / Monk 1
author: Maximillian_Kane

posts.author: Maximillian_Kane
posts.content:
Hail, mighty ECBers!

Since there was a discussion on the Build Request forums about a build with this exact class combo, I felt compelled to post this build here. I've had in on my computer for about 2 years, but never got around to posting it.

 To me, this build is both a rework of my Shadow Priest build, and a representation of a very specific stereotype of character that is very common in literature, movies and on TV. This guy could be Batman, Judge Nicholas Marshall from Dark Justice, the Daredevil, the Punisher, etc.. He basically wears the upstanding citizen mask during the day, and goes out at night to conduct his secret business, which could be hunting down criminals, or in this case, adventuring. 

Powergaming-wise the potential for this build's class combo is monstruous. 10 attacks per round Hasted with Flurry of Blows, IKD and full undispellable Clerical Goodies, Epic Dodge and 50% Concealment from Improved Invisibility with the Trickery Domain. Oh, and TRAPS, he CAN recover all epic traps with just a +2 boost to his skill or INT scores. Nothing that Divine Trickery, a Ring of Clear Thought +4 or Gloves of the Rogue can't accomplish. He can also SET said traps after recovering them, just in case his awesome melee skills are, for some reason, insufficient to deal with the threats.

One of the main problems with the Shadow Priest was that I didn't feel like I had enough skill points to get everything I wanted, because of the heavy investment required by Hide and Move Silently. But HiPS made it absolutely worth the investment. This guy, on the other hand, is more versatile, thanks to UMD and Trapping, and deadlier, thanks to Sneak Attacks and TWF feats, but slightly worse defensively, because he doesn't have HiPS and the stealth skills. 

I should also mention that this build has a 20% XP penalty from level 21 onwards.

EDIT: I should also probably mention that Defensive Roll NEEDS to be selected at BEFORE Epic Dodge. As Webshaman mentioned in the other topic, the option to take Epic Dodge is only available once one has Defensive Roll selected. But the CBC lists general feats first, then Bonus Feats. I take Defensive Roll  with the Rogue bonus feat, which you can do in any order in game, then Epic Dodge with a General feat, which on the CBC is shown before. No biggie, but just to clarify.

posts.author: Maximillian_Kane
posts.content:
Bjorn_Blockbreaker wrote: ↑
Aug 10, 2021
Out of curiosity, why start with a str of 8?  why not str 10 and wis or dex 15 to start with?
Divine Power sets your STR to 18 when you cast it (and you should almost always do), so why waste 2 stat points there for no reason?

Also, because you're a Monk too, you add your Wisdom to your AC, and because you're a DEX-based meleer with Weapon Finesse, you add your DEX to AB and AC, so why lower them?

posts.author: Bjorn_Blockbreaker
posts.content: That makes perfect sense!  Thanks for the explanation.

His entire adult life with an XP penalty?  Brutal, unless you're starting at 40.  For whatever reason, this guy screams "Assassin" to me (waits for Max to post a Cleric/XX/Assassin build).
Well, the thing is that XP penalty is only relevant if you play Single Player modules. For PWs, XP is infinite, so it really doesn't matter that much. and I have posted a Cleric / Assassin build, but not combat-focused like these ones. It's my NWN interpretation of BG's Viconia De'Vir, a full Clerical caster with Assassin just as a class to do a late Tumble and UMD dump. The thing about Assassin + Cleric is that both kind of want a lot of levels to be effective at what they aim to do, and you only have 40 levels to play around with, sadly. LOL
